column4: Could anyone explain to me how to safely upgrade my (proprietary) AMD graphics drivers? Apparently I have to uninstall the old versions first, and I'm terrified of doing that after the nightmare I went through getting them to work in the first place...
btw, if you get a black screen after that, you need to remove a specific file  ( /etc/ati/amdpcsdb ) and reboot
try unplugging and then plugging the cables
do you have any other ideas? I'm totally stuck...
how would I do that? Google seems to suggest that I'd need to be able to change some config files before that would be an option...
no, you dont need to do that
Sorry, but remove and add to...?
press e or c to edit the kernel command line in grub2
in that case, dpkg should be able to repair the system, I think
